creator: durgesh.x.yadav@gmail.com
text:
i have apache 2.0.59 64 bit running on RH Linux ES 4x and apache rotatelogs in consuming very high percentage of memory over a period of time (with in 1-2 months). rotatelogs consumes around 50-75% (4-6GB out of 8GB) of RAM.
 
please help me with this problem.
This might be 40183 (https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=40183) could you please try the patch given there in comment #3 and report back if this solves your problem?
creator: rpluem@apache.org
durgesh.x.yadav@gmail.com
text:
i looked into https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=40183 and it has been reported for SUN Solaris and i am using Red Hat Linux can i use the same fix provided in comment#3?

kindly let me know if i can use the same fix. I am new bee to Apache would also like to know how to use rotatelogs.c to fix my problem?

creator: takashi.asfbugzilla@tks.st
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> i looked into https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=40183 and it
> has been reported for SUN Solaris and i am using Red Hat Linux can i use the
> same fix provided in comment#3?

Yes

Nearly 3 years have passed, reporter hasn't come back and this is pretty clearly a duplicate of 40183 so mark it as a duplicate.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 40183 ***
creator: ben@reser.org
